str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To be of good courage, good cheer, be bold. From tharsos; to have courage.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
